result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott D Pesicek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Concurrent with: Count 2 and Dodge County Case 14CM484, if revoked.
Concurrent with: Count 2 and Dodge County Case 14CM484.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  DNA surcharge is waived.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
No contact with Forston Construction Co.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions.
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Scott D Pesicek in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to both counts 1 & 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of both counts 1 & 2.
Count 3 is dismissed as a read in.




Court orders the following:
Count 1:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
Concurrent to:  count 2 & Dodge County Case  14CM484.
STAYED.

Term of Probation: 15  Months
Concurrent to:  count 2 & Dodge County Case  14CM484.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Forston Construction Company.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Costs:  $243
DRGOD Surchare:  $10
DNA Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.


CONDITION TIME: 
20  Days in the Waukesha County Jail - w/huber (all standard release conditions). 
STAYED - To be used at agent's discretion.  





Count 2:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
Concurrent to:  count 1 & Dodge County Case  14CM484.
STAYED.

Term of Probation: 12  Months
Concurrent to:  count 1 & Dodge County Case  14CM484.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Same as count 1.

Costs: $243
DRGOD Surcharge:  $10
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Defendant Scott D Pesicek in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  
Parties are still working on a restitution amount.
